title: Repo sync
author: docs-bot
details: Added prerequisite note in Azure VNET setup documentation: Outbound traffic must avoid TLS interception due to certificate trust issues, with a link to Azure Firewall Premium certificate details.
Added troubleshooting note for GitHub-hosted larger runners: Referenced TLS interception requirements when using Azure private networking.
Provided workaround suggestion: Use custom images if TLS interception is required.
summary:

- Added troubleshooting note for GitHub-hosted larger runners: Referenced TLS interception requirements when using Azure private networking.
- Provided workaround suggestion: Use custom images if TLS interception is required.
generated_title: Clarify TLS interception restrictions for Azure private networking in GitHub Actions
commits: **9235b5a**: Actions Private Networking: Clarify outbound network traffic must not go via tls interception (#59159) (by Lawrence Gripper)
original_description:
This is an automated pull request to sync changes between the public and private repos.
Our bot will merge this pull request automatically.
To preserve continuity across repos, _do not squash_ this pull request.
raw_analysis:
### Summary
- Added prerequisite note in Azure VNET setup documentation: Outbound traffic must avoid TLS interception due to certificate trust issues, with a link to Azure Firewall Premium certificate details.
- Added troubleshooting note for GitHub-hosted larger runners: Referenced TLS interception requirements when using Azure private networking.
- Provided workaround suggestion: Use custom images if TLS interception is required.

### Title
Clarify TLS interception restrictions for Azure private networking in GitHub Actions
